alert.note: Alert for La Plata (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 30 at 8:55AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT WILL LEAD TO HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ACROSS MANY TRIBUTARIES AND THE MAIN STEM OF THE MANCOS RIVER THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... Snowmelt from above normal/record seasonal snowpack combined with warm, spring temperatures have increased flow rates well above normal for this time of year along the Mancos River. Temperatures will continue to climb 10 to 15 degrees above normal, peaking on Monday, May 1st. Expect accelerated snowmelt to continue through the beginning half of the week. County roadways and low lying areas along the Mancos River within Montezuma County may become inundated with water, making river crosses difficult or impossible. Please heed all road closures and find an alternate route.
